dmca.title: [ABUSE] Plagiarism on a Planet hosted site.
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, March 24, 2006 2:35 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Plagiarism on a Planet hosted site.

This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Thursday, March 23, 2006
at
07:56:57 and concerns a matter for which responsibility is delegated to your
team. The message and headers follow.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

SUBJECT:
[ABUSE] Plagiarism on a Planet hosted site.

MESSAGE BODY:

Dear ThePlanet.com

I'm writing regarding a site hosted on The Planet that has significantly
plagiarized from various sites on the web, including my own, in violation of
the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. The specific site in question is
http://www.contentconcepts.net/. This copyright violation came to my
attention when I crosschecked my page http://
www.editorsforstudents.com/editing.html on http://www.copyscape.com.
Archive.org will show that the plagiarized copy originally appeared on my
page. In all likelihood, judging from my past experience, plagiarized copy
appears on other pages on this site.

Contentconcepts.net's flagrant plagraisim creates the impression that copy
appearing on my site may itself have been plagiarized, and therefore
undermines the originality and veracity of editorsforstudents.com. As a
result, I'm forced to write to request, pursuant to the recommendations of
the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, that you take further action,
including, if necessary, removing Contentconcepts.net from it's current home
on the Internet until their site is revised to comply with copyright law.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
James Brown
EditorsForStudents.com
